Method Detail

average

public static double average(java.util.Vector vec,
                             int size)
                      throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Calculates the average of the vector of Double, vec.

The average is calculated for items from index(0) to index(size-1).

A uniform probability distribution is assumed.

Adapted from wFFRunAvgConv.

Parameters:
vec - a Vector of Double values
size - the size of the Vector the average should be calculated to
Returns:
the average of Double values from index(0) to index(size-1)
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException - if size is 0 to indicate a divide by zero

varPop

public static double varPop(java.util.Vector vec,
                            int size)
                     throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Calculates the variance of items in vec from index(0) to index(size-1).

The variance calculated assumes all measurements in a population are in vec. (Versus a random sample.)

Note that this function may not be the safest in terms of numerical computation errors (such as roundoff, etc.)

Adapted from wFFRunAvgConv.

Parameters:
vec - a Vector of Double values
size - the size of the Vector the variance should be calculated over
Returns:
the variance over a population
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException - if size is 0 to indicate a divide by zero

varSample

public static double varSample(java.util.Vector vec,
                               int size)
                        throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Calculates the sample variance of items in vec from index(0) to index(size-1).

The variance calculated assumes all measurements in a sample are in vec.

Note that this function may not be the safest in terms of numerical computation errors (such as roundoff, etc.)

Adapted from wFFRunAvgConv.

Parameters:
vec - a Vector of Double values
size - the size of the Vector the variance should be calculated over
Returns:
the variance over a population
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException - if size is 0 to indicate a divide by zero

subVec

                                      int startIndex,
                                      int endIndex)
Returns the subvector of vec that lies between the specified indices.

Adapted from wFFRunAvgConv.

Parameters:
vec - the Vector
startIndex - the starting index (inclusive)
endIndex - the ending index (inclusive)
Returns:
the subvector of vec between startIndex and endIndex inclusive

getConsecAvg

public static java.util.Vector getConsecAvg(java.util.Vector vec,
                                            int startIndex,
                                            int interval,
                                            int numIntervals)
                                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Gets the averages of each subwindow.

This looks at the numIntervals sub-windows of size interval in the range [startIndex, startIndex+numIntervals*interval)

Adapted from wFFRunAvgConv.

Parameters:
vec - the Vector of Double to test matching averages in
startIndex - the start index of the first subvector
interval - the size of the subvectors
numIntervals - the number of intervals
Returns:
the averages
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
